The current Constitution of Ukraine was adopted on June 28, 1996. According to the Constitution, Ukraine is a sovereign and independent, democratic, social, legal state. Human rights in Ukraine are human rights enshrined in Section 2 of the Constitution of Ukraine “Rights, Freedoms and Duties of a Person and a Citizen”.
